page.title: 09ORSETT COCK INTERCHANGE.
page.content: The most important arterial aspect of the area is the new A13 and Orsett Cock roundabout.This Orsett Cock to Stanford-le-Hope Interchange is a two lane dual carriageway which completes linkage between Southend,Tilbury Docks and the M.25.At a cost of Â£6 million it was opened 3 months ahead of schedule on 27th.June,1985.It has extensive overhead lighting,French drainage and multi-coloured cats eyes-amber at"kerb" and central reservation,white at centre lane and red at junctions.Leaving the A13 at the Orsett Cock raised roundabout gives access to the A128 to Tilbury or Brentwood (and thence to the A127 London-Southend Arterial road) and the old A13,now Stanford Road,for local routes.
